content: clucky ladies chicken ear warmer an original knitting pattern by stephanie gilbert of rosie posie knit co 1 email me @ rosieposieknitco@gmail com for pattern support follow me @rosieposieknito & use #cluckyladies for all of your instagram photos i m a sucker for anything with chickens on it we have a small flock of backyard chickens at our house and i love watching them strut around the yard i wanted to make a fun quick chicken ear warmer that could easily be made into any holiday knit simply by changing the colors of yarn used enjoy making your own flock of clucky ladies each season pattern notes the colorwork section is both written and charted so you can do whichever you prefer regardless of the size you are working on the chart is written in multiples of 12 therefore you may find it helpful to place a stitch marker after each section of 12 stitches using a unique one for the beginning of round as with all colorwork the hardest part is keeping your gauge even and not getting it too tight make sure to do a colorwork gauge swatch before beginning if you find you are knitting too tight on the colorwork go up a needle size or two until you find gauge it s also a good idea to spread your stitches out over your needles periodically as you go to prevent your work from getting too tight there are only a few places in the ear warmer where you will have to catch long floats but it is a good rule of thumb to do so when you use one color for more than approximately 1 or 5 stitches i personally find that doing two-handed knitting is the easiest way to keep my gauge even on colorwork here is a helpful video for showing you how to do that https //www youtube com/watch v=bd7arufsuvg size adult one size you can easily make this ear warmer for other sizes by simply changing the number of stitches you cast on in multiples of 12 typically i use 84 stitches for child 72 for toddler and 60 for baby size you may want to remove a few row before and after the colorwork chickens depending on the size you choose to make gauge 22 sts and 22 row in 4 10 2 cm in stockinette stitch in colorwork pattern on larger needles finished measurements after blocking 19 48 cm circumference x 4 25 11cm height yarn nature spun worsted 100% wool from brown sheep company or any worsted weight yarn that meets gauge yardage required all measurements are approximate mc navy
